title: Drawing, "Drawing for Hemmerle Bracelet", 1993
medium: Brush and gouache, watercolor and glazing on tracing paper.
description: Drawing of gold, emerald, and sapphire bangle with four images below of stones in plan and perspective.  Bangle was first produced in 1994 on commission with modifications.  The bangle was then produced out of two materials, half in white gold and half in yellow gold.
justification: Stefan Hemmerle’s original conception of the Harmony Bangle featured exquisite gems set within the finest base materials.&nbsp; This concept drawing for a Harmony Bangle, executed by a member of the firm’s staff after a design by Stefan Hemmerle, illustrates a bracelet of gold set with jewels of exceptional quality—an emerald on one end and a sapphire on the other.&nbsp; The careful rendering emphasizes the rounded forms of the jewels by illustrating them both in profile and from above, and directs attention to the harmonious contrast of brilliant colors.&nbsp; The drawing of the bracelet from an angle emphasizes the circular fluidity that characterizes the Bangle.&nbsp;

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Drawing for Hemmerle Bracelet", 1993.Brush and gouache, watercolor and glazing on tracing paper.. Gift of Hemmerle. 2012-23-2.
